author: screamizh123
post_text: September 25, 2018 at 5:24 PM#1Hello! I want to assign effect Low Value with command:Assign Effect 1.1.1 thru 1.1.2 /lowvalue=How can i use my preset here? Something like "2.1 Position".I tried a lot of ways, does not work(

posts.author: screamizh123
posts.post_text: September 25, 2018 at 5:24 PM#1Hello! I want to assign effect Low Value with command:Assign Effect 1.1.1 thru 1.1.2 /lowvalue=How can i use my preset here? Something like "2.1 Position".I tried a lot of ways, does not work(

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: September 25, 2018 at 11:50 PM#2as there are no direct way to assign a preset to the lowvalue property, there are two different approaches, depending on what you are actually trying to do:to build a new effect with preset 2.1 as lowvalue:select the effect low layerCodeLayer EffectLowcall the presetCodeAt preset 2.1set values for the other layersStore as new effect.-----to change the presetcontent used for low-value in an existing effect:have the effect low-value reference a permanent placeholder preset.e.g Preset 2.99 "mylowvalue"change the content of this placeholder preset with your desired presets:Copy Preset 2.1 At Preset 2.99 /overwrite

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: September 26, 2018 at 8:29 AM#3HiYou can change low value as a preset withselfix effect x; at preset 2.1 /layer=effectlow; store effect x

posts.author: screamizh123
posts.post_text: September 26, 2018 at 8:50 AM#4Thank you so much!
